texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Working with the RAID configurations on Linux can be a little involved if all you have is hpacucli. Luckily, the folks using HP's OS distributions will get tools like hwraidinfo and hwraid status, but you can get these going in Linux as well.
texts.text: Working with the RAID configurations on Linux can be a little involved if all you have is hpacucli. Luckily, the folks using HP's OS distributions will get tools like hwraidinfo and hwraid status, but you can get these going in Linux as well.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Here's a bash script equivalent of hwraidinfo which will work in Linux:
texts.text: Here's a bash script equivalent of hwraidinfo which will work in Linux:

texts.label: code
texts.orig:
#!/bin/sh
SLOTLIST=$(hpacucli ctrl all show | \
grep Slot | sed -e 's/^.*Slot //g' -e 's/ .*$//g')
for i in $SLOTLIST
do
echo
hpacucli ctrl slot=$i show | grep -v "^$"
echo
hpacucli ctrl slot=$i ld all show | grep -v "^$"
hpacucli ctrl slot=$i pd all show | grep -v "^$"
done
echo
texts.text:
#!/bin/sh
SLOTLIST=$(hpacucli ctrl all show | \
grep Slot | sed -e 's/^.*Slot //g' -e 's/ .*$//g')
for i in $SLOTLIST
do
echo
hpacucli ctrl slot=$i show | grep -v "^$"
echo
hpacucli ctrl slot=$i ld all show | grep -v "^$"
hpacucli ctrl slot=$i pd all show | grep -v "^$"
done
echo

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: And here is the script equivalent of hwraidstatus:
texts.text: And here is the script equivalent of hwraidstatus:

texts.label: code
texts.orig:
#!/bin/sh
SLOTLIST=$(hpacucli ctrl all show | \
grep Slot | sed -e 's/^.*Slot //g' -e 's/ .*$//g')
for i in $SLOTLIST
do
echo
hpacucli ctrl slot=$i show status | grep -v "^$"
echo
hpacucli ctrl slot=$i ld all show status | grep -v "^$"
hpacucli ctrl slot=$i pd all show status | grep -v "^$"
done
echo
texts.text:
#!/bin/sh
SLOTLIST=$(hpacucli ctrl all show | \
grep Slot | sed -e 's/^.*Slot //g' -e 's/ .*$//g')
for i in $SLOTLIST
do
echo
hpacucli ctrl slot=$i show status | grep -v "^$"
echo
hpacucli ctrl slot=$i ld all show status | grep -v "^$"
hpacucli ctrl slot=$i pd all show status | grep -v "^$"
done
echo

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Save these to the filesystem, run
texts.text: Save these to the filesystem, run

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: and move them to /usr/sbin (or /usr/local/sbin) so that the root user can use them.
texts.text: and move them to /usr/sbin (or /usr/local/sbin) so that the root user can use them.
